message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it proposes an extension to a recently proposed architecture for hierarchical reinforcement learning. It also involves the estimation of gradients and the use of function approximation, which are common techniques in machine learning. Additionally, the paper may also be relevant to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories as it deals with reinforcement learning, which is a popular approach in these fields. The paper may also be relevant to the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category as it involves the optimization of a control policy. Finally, the paper may be relevant to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category as it involves the use of neural networks to approximate the policy and termination functions of an option.
